ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1 - 8 hr/week
At least ten. This course was a ton of work.
As a practicum, a significant amount of time was spent meeting, collecting data, and analyzing findings outside of the classroom. Our project involved 5hour observations on 12 different days.
This course took six to eight hours per week invested outside of the classroom.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Slow start as we had to surmount hurdles such as the HIC approval before we could begin. Later, more hours were required. At first it was difficult to understand what our tasks were. These gradually became clearer.

Strength = real world, practical experienceWeakness = A lot of classroom time that is not very relevant to skills we need for the project (e.g. classroom discussions on leadership, communication, etc.)
The course is practical and insightful. It allows you to have hands-on experience in program planning.
Great course!
It was alright. In the end I wonder if it was more work than it was worth.

The course's intentions are good though each group's experience will be different. My group was unsure of our projects goals and outcomes from the beginning which led to a rocky first couple months. The classtime was sometimes helpful and othertimes not.
This course is FAR too time-intensive and is completely overweighted as compared to all other classes. This class was not a favorite this semester.

Unique opportunity to practice core public health skills, learn about realities of community work with the support of an academic class and academic community. Course materials helpful and assignments useful for planning the schedule for the semester and division of labor. One suggestion is having each group have it's own workshop with the TAs and instructor in order to discuss project plan and workload in more detail.

Overall, this course was good. It provided me with the opportunity to learn new skills, and work within the community. However, class time seemed unnecessary. Some of the lectures were useful, while others were not very helpful and that time could've been better spent on the projects.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Good class exercises. Great food - really added to the comraderie.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  It is evident that Dr. Humphries is passionate about what she does. She provided good quality information and was helpful in setting us up for successful projects.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  She is very approachable and knowledgeable

Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  One can be certain that Debbie truly wants her students to have great experiences. Class-time though sometimes was oversimplified and unhelpful. Group dynamics are important but could be discussed in a more professional and applicable way.

Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  Dr. Humphries was readily available to students and helping in resolving logistical barriers. She was a thoughtful instructor and also planned an interesting line up of guest speakers.
Instructor: Debbie Lee Humphries  She was a good prof, very invested in learning and the community projects.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Concerned. Gave timely feedback.
Great
Whitney Hubbard was accessible if we ever needed her though throughout the course we never called on her for specific guidance.
The TA was helpful whenever needed.
Sharon TaylorSharon was helping in moving the group along in terms of deadlines. More input in the data analysis phase would have been helpful.
TA's were good - responsive and helpful.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, I would highly recommend the course
The practicum can be a great way to get your feet wet with research and community groups throguhout Connecticut. It will take some time but the final result is gratifying.
Try to avoid this class if possible. If it is needed to graduate, then it is a necessary evil that will have to be completed.
Yes, I would highly recommend this course to other students. It was an invaluable opportunity.
It is a course that provides you the opportunity to work in the community and attend lecture.
